data.title: The Pitch Perfect TV spin-off has a release date
data.meta_description: Popular movie Pitch Perfect is getting a TV spin-off featuring original character Bumper Allen, played by actor Adam Devine, called Bumper In Berlin.
data.text:
It features one of the film's original stars!

Hold onto your hats because we have some acca-awesome news for you... The TV spin-off of legendary movie Pitch Perfect finally has a release date!

The iconic movie series, which starred the likes of Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson, Skylar Astin and Brittany Snow, will make an comeback in the form of a TV series called Bumper In Berlin, featuring the film's original character Bumper Allen, played by actor Adam Devine.

When does Bumper In Berlin start?

Although there's no UK release date just yet, it has now been revealed Bumper In Berlin will air on Peacock over in America on 11th November 2022.

What is Bumper In Berlin?

Bumper In Berlin is the TV spin-off to Pitch Perfect.

Bumper's character heads up acapella group The Treblemakers in the first movie, The Barden Bellas' direct competitor at Barden University.

And after Bumper played a security guard in the second movie, the TV spin-off will follow Bumper as he moves to Germany to pursue his music career when one of his songs become a big hit in Berlin.

Pitch Perfect's commentator Elizabeth Banks, who appears in all three movies as Gail Abernathy-McKadden, was the executive producer of the TV show, with Adam Devine also featuring as an executive producer.

Susan Rovner, chairman of entertainment content for NBCUniversal Television and Streaming, told Variety last year: "Our upcoming Pitch Perfect series is another example of the unmatched synergy NBCUniversal is able to expand upon with our wide-ranging library of IP.

"When we saw the opportunity to create a series for Pitch Perfect with executive producers Elizabeth Banks, Max Handelman and Paul Brooks plus more earworm classics for super fans to enjoy, we jumped at it.

"And to top it off, we are so fortunate that Adam Devine is headlining the series and bringing fans the quirky, laugh-out-loud sensibility they loved in the film franchise."
